Question
========

In recent US elections, 55% of all voters voted Republican and 45% did not. Of the Republicans, 80% vote for candidate X, and of the non-Republicans, 10% vote for candidate X. Take one random voter in the US and define the event B as: Vote for the candidate X. Then what is the probability of P(B)?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,045
* 0,440
* 0,485
* 0,550

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.045: Incorrect
* 0.440: Incorrect
* 0.485: Correct
* 0.550: Incorrect
